intro: Lissochilus elatus, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine regions. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
